comments.center_target_appearance_time: References the Definition for the center target cue behavior. Treated as an event at the timestamp in this column.
comments.lateral_target_appearance_time: References the Definition for the lateral target stimulus. Treated as an event at the timestamp in this column.
comments.cursor_departure_time: References the Definition for the monkey's wrist movement. This column represents the real-time detection of the action initiation (cursor leaving start zone).
comments.reward_time: References the Definition for the reward outcome (juice delivery).
comments.movement_type: Categorical column defining the direction of movement (flexion vs extension). Requires a separate JSON sidecar to map these string values to specific HED tags (e.g., 'flexion' -> '(Flexion)').
comments.torque_perturbation_type: Categorical column defining the direction/existence of the perturbation. Requires a separate JSON sidecar to map values to tags.
comments.torque_perturbation_onset_time: References the Definition for the mechanical torque pulse. Removed invalid 'Mechanical-stimulation'/'Force' tags, replaced with 'Sensory-event', 'Tactile-presentation', and a 'Label'.
comments.derived_movement_onset_time: Using the Onset tag with the Cursor-movement Definition creates a temporal scope for the movement duration. Marked as Computed-feature to distinguish from the real-time cursor departure detection.
comments.derived_movement_end_time: Using the Offset tag paired with the onset column closes the temporal scope of the movement event. Marked as Computed-feature.
comments.derived_peak_velocity: The magnitude of the peak velocity. Removed '/#' placeholder to resolve validation error; the tag 'Speed' characterizes the numeric data in this column.
comments.derived_peak_velocity_time: An event acting as a data marker for the moment peak velocity occurred. 'Data-maximum' and 'Speed' indicate what reached a peak at this time.
comments.derived_movement_amplitude: Numeric distance of the movement. Removed '/#' placeholder to resolve validation error; 'Distance' characterizes the data.
comments.derived_end_position: Final joint position. Removed '/#' placeholder to resolve validation error; 'Angle' characterizes the data.
